definition: jade-like stone/clean and white/tinkling of pendants
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
Shi Lang (1621-1696), Chinese admiral who served under the Ming and Qing Dynasties
lit. to fill one's eyes with glittering jewels/a literary masterpiece or sb of extraordinary talent (idiom)
Captain William M Lang (1843-), British adviser to the Qing north China navy 北洋水師|北洋水师 during the 1880s
Langya district of Chuzhou city 滁州市[Chu2 zhou1 shi4], Anhui

sentences.english: Mount Langya, which stands on the southwest outskirts of Chuzhou in Anhui Province, is well known for its scenic charm.
sentences.chinese: 安徽省滁州市西南郊的琅玡山，向以山水醉人著稱。

sentences.english: The Langya culture came into being in major environment of Yanqi culture.
sentences.chinese: 琅琊文化在燕齊文化的大環境中形成。

sentences.english: Langye Wang was influenced by the culture of seaside region and had the Tianshi religion faith in generate.
sentences.chinese: 琅邪王氏受濱海地域文化之熏習，世代信仰天師道。

definition: (archaic) to give birth to a child/to rear
(of the day) long/old variant of 暢|畅[chang4]
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
